attributes.action: Give all pregnant women the opportunity to receive an anomaly scan at 20 weeks' gestation and stop the current 'Postcode lottery'
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Many women in this country do not receive an anomaly scan on the NHS, whilst many do. I think it is unfair that pregnant women are missing this vital service due to where they live, or being forced into paying in excess of £100 for the scan to be performed privately. This scan isn't abut wanting to see your baby; it is about identifying and diagnosing potential life threatening problems and I think it is unfair that local Health Authorities decide who can and cannot have the scan.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Give all pregnant women the opportunity to receive an anomaly scan at 20 weeks' gestation and stop the current 'Postcode lottery'."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page15529.asp
